answers.text: ancient Japanese soldiers from traditional warrior families
mainly in the north of Japan

qas.question: Where did the imperial family live?

context: Bushi was the name given to the <a0_0>ancient Japanese soldiers from traditional warrior families<a0_0/>. The bushi class was developed <a1_0>mainly in the north of Japan<a1_0/>. They formed powerful clans, which in the 12th century were against the noble families who were grouping themselves to support the imperial family who lived in <a2_0>Kyoto<a2_0/>. Samurai was a word used by the Kuge aristocratic class with warriors themselves preferring the word bushi. The term Bushidō, <a3_0>the "way of the warrior"<a3_0/>, is derived from this term and <a4_0>the mansion of a warrior<a4_0/> was called bukeyashiki.
